intro: Indigofera reducta, commonly known as the small indigo or lesser indigo, is a species of flowering plant in the legume family, Fabaceae. It is native to parts of Africa and is characterized by its small, delicate flowers that range in color from blue to purple. The plant typically grows as an annual or biennial herb, reaching heights of up to 30 centimeters. Its leaves are trifoliate, consisting of three small, oval-shaped leaflets. Indigofera reducta is often found in disturbed soils and can thrive in arid or semi-arid conditions.
